Title: Full Stack Developer
Job_Description:
About AbbVie
AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.
We’re looking for a full-stack software developer who has a background with building web applications on cloud infrastructure and deploying these applications with modern containerization. The successful candidate should be able to rapidly and iteratively build business critical solutions using their technical expertise in software development, data visualization, and data warehousing. Being able to interpret business requirements and bring delightful solutions is a core ability for this position. You’ll be part of a small team of highly motivated developers and will be responsible for delivering multiple software solutions year over year. Sharing and leading our team with your expertise in) web app development and cloud deployment (Docker/Kubernetes is an essential function of this role.

Title: Full Stack Developer
Job_Description:
Identify, engineer, and optimize new data, software, and technology solutions in order to address critical
business needs in a timely manner. Read and adapt literature and publically available information to
accomplish assignments. Demonstrate broad and versatile technical expertise in software development,
data warehousing, statistics, data visualization and/or technology infrastructure (including servers,
storage, network connectivity, and virtualization/cloud environments). Technology Engineers will be

Title: Full Stack Developer
Job_Description:
AbbVie Information Security is looking for a highly motivated, diligent, and skillful Site Reliability Engineer to join the Cyber Security Engineering (CSE) Team. The CSE Team, working within the Cyber Security Operations (CSO) function, is responsible for designing, deploying, maintaining, and optimizing the toolsets in use by the Information Security teams. Join us as a Site Reliability Engineer, Cyber Security Engineering to support and improve our efforts to defend against adversaries and help our business continue to have remarkable impacts on people’s lives.
The Site Reliability Engineer will be responsible for ensuring production systems in use by the Security Teams are operating smoothly, within uptime objectives, and updated with the latest content and functionality. The SRE, coordinating with DevOps engineers and developers, will monitor the pulse of system performance and capacity, proactively recommending and implementing changes while automating ‘toil’ and repetitive tasks.
The ideal candidate should have prior experience with cloud service offerings, scripting, Linux administration, serverless architectures, and containerization of applications.

Title: Full Stack Developer
Job_Description:
Purpose:
Manufacturing equipment and processes require a high degree of specialized attention around the clock. The primary objective is to maximize efficiency and prevent any interruption of production by achieving control over the systems the manufacturing cycle depends on. Primarily these systems include facility, equipment, utility, and controls. These systems are maintained and continually improved by Engineer Technician I’s. They also contribute to the design of processes.

Responsibilities:
Provides software programming development utilizing Siemens PPCL coding language to write code that is loaded on building automation system (BAS) controllers that control the operation of HVAC and related mechanical systems. Software Developers typically interpret instructions from written sequence of operations created by the mechanical and controls design engineers.

Title: Full Stack Developer
Job_Description:
Looking for IAM Engineer to help with driving enterprise identity and access management architecture, enabling automation and self-service capabilities that stream identity lifecycle. Responsible for supporting the planning, design, development, and deployment of a centralized identity and access management (IAM) solution. Provide subject matter expertise in a variety of technical and non-technical settings. Work collaboratively with technology and business groups to conceive, design, and implement IAM solutions that solve business problems.
Key contributor to the strategy, design, and management of the enterprise IAM program:
Build a strong IAM foundation. Integrate IAM systems with in-house applications and third-party applications
Translate high level requirements into detailed technical designs, and lead design sessions and code walkthrough

Title: Full Stack Developer
Job_Description:
The individual works within cross-functional teams and provides software requirements, design and implementation for current and next generation software and systems projects. He or she develops a thorough understanding of design requirements to ensure that the system’s objectives are properly defined and ultimately achieved.
This role is focused on Windows development. This individual must have strong technical skills complemented by great communications and teamwork qualities. Experience in a software development background in a structured/regulated environment such as medical device development is required.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following (other duties may be assigned.):
Design, develop, and support embedded, Windows desktop applications.

Title: Full Stack Developer
Job_Description:
SUMMARY
As the Senior DevOps Test Automation Engineer, you are an emerging leader who will nurture and scale our enterprise DevOps testing capabilities to accelerate AbbVie’s digital solution delivery. This position requires an individual with leadership potential and significant experience in DevOps test automation. You will lead larger test automation efforts independently and act as a subject matter expert to team members on smaller efforts.
Do you love developing and delivering testing best practices and processes to teams on an enterprise scale?
Do you love applying your deep practical knowledge of DevOps testing approaches to help teams deliver delightful digital experiences?
Do you love working collaboratively with diverse technical teams?

Title: Full Stack Developer
Job_Description:
The Senior Automation Engineer provides automation support for manufacturing operations in accordance with appropriate GMP and safety guidelines. This support includes change control implementation, deviation investigation, routine automation computer system support activities, and off hours automation computer system support. The Senior Automation Engineer also leads non-routine automation computer system support activities, delivers engineering projects to the business, can utilize first principles in delivery of these solutions, and can recommend new control strategies for the various chemical processes utilized in manufacturing operations.
The Senior Automation Engineer performs engineering design and installation services for automated process equipment, facility systems and software systems. They perform troubleshooting and corrective maintenance on all facility and production equipment. Primary responsibility is for maintaining automated electromechanical systems and software. This includes project support related to facility modifications, equipment installations, and maintenance activities. Typical project work involves developing specification for equipment and systems and coordinating implementation activities to place the systems into service.

Title: Full Stack Developer
Job_Description:
About AbbVie
AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.
We’re looking for a full-stack software developer who has a background with building web applications on cloud infrastructure and deploying these applications with modern containerization. The successful candidate should be able to rapidly and iteratively build business critical solutions using their technical expertise in software development, data visualization, and data warehousing. Being able to interpret business requirements and bring delightful solutions is a core ability for this position. You’ll be part of a small team of highly motivated developers and will be responsible for delivering multiple software solutions year over year. Sharing and leading our team with your expertise in) web app development and cloud deployment (Docker/Kubernetes is an essential function of this role.

Title: Full Stack Developer
Job_Description:
Description
The Genomic Research Center (GRC) at AbbVie is seeking a highly motivated computational biologist/bioinformatics scientist to play a Scientist I Informatics role in a multi-disciplinary team focused on developing new therapies for the treatment of cancer. AbbVie GRC spans multiple locations and therapeutic areas. This enables our capabilities to be leveraged from the perspective of a research community: a shared code base, innovative project engagement, and an extensive mentoring and development program that combine to create a vibrant and exciting career opportunity.


The successful candidate will be based at AbbVie South San Francisco site and will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced and highly collaborative environment to contribute to discovery and clinical development across AbbVie oncology programs or other therapeutic relative areas. The candidate will work closely with computational biologists, research project teams and IT professionals to build/support front-end and back-end platforms and develop NGS pipelines.

Title: Salesforce Marketing Cloud Developer
Job_Description:
AbbVie US Commercial Organization is looking for a Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) Developer to develop and implement campaigns, projects, & solutions within its Marketing Technology stack, with a primary focus on SFMC. This position is in the Patient & Consumer Marketing, Marketing Activation team and will play a critical role in AbbVie’s digital transformation journey to rapidly deliver high quality omni-channel experiences to consumers & patients across the whole US brand portfolio.
This position reports directly to the Associate Director, Patient & Consumer Marketing, Marketing Activation, and will work across multiple cross-functional partners including marketing operations, SFMC operations/squads/pods teams, technical product owners, SFMC & Solution Architects, and relevant marketing organizations
The ideal candidate will have exceptional SFMC development expertise, innovative problem-solving abilities, incredible flexibility, and a keen drive to learn, achieve, and optimize. This role will support and lead many activities including but not limited to solution & technical design, platform development, campaign & platform configuration and QA, technical documentation, and campaign & capability deployment.

Title: Manager, QA Project Management, IT Systems, and Operational Excellence
Job_Description:
Manager, QA Project Management, IT Systems, and Operational Excellence

Purpose: Manager, QA Project Management, IT Systems, and Operational Excellence will be accountable for the successful delivery of assigned process programs and projects, building the strategy and plan related to IT systems for the organization, along with identifying and implementing operational excellence improvement projects/programs. The role will serve as a key contributor in end-to-end project/program objectives and outcomes, especially driving efficiency and agility, and delivering new systems or system improvements to increase the success of the operations. This role will drive projects across the various GxPs and will provide various opportunities to communicate recommendations to senior-levels.

Title: Manager, QA Project Management, IT Systems, and Operational Excellence
Job_Description:
Purpose:
The Agile Transformation Coach serves as an accelerator for the adoption of Agile ways of working within their organization. This role will provide training and coaching to build maturity in Agile approaches as well as guide a single delivery team within their organization as they transition from a traditional work style into an Agile mindset, behaviors, practices, and frameworks: Scrum, Kanban and a Scaled Agile. The role will measure progress to overcome obstacles and drive continuous improvement and champion Agile to stakeholders.

Responsibilities:
Develop, deliver, and/or coordinate with external providers to provision training and workshops on agile frameworks (e.g., Scrum, Kanban, Scaled Agile Framework) and practices (e.g., conducting daily stand-ups, retrospectives, backlog management).

Title: Manager, QA Project Management, IT Systems, and Operational Excellence
Job_Description: AbbVie is looking for a highly motivated and talented Technical Program Manager (TPM) to help the Security Strategy & Intelligence (S&I) team meet its goals. This newly created team is building new products and services within the Information Security and Risk Management (ISRM) organization at AbbVie. A strong TPM is needed to be the backbone of growing team and helping ensure we’re effectively executing against a well-defined strategy. This includes working directly with the Sr. Director of Strategy & Intelligence to help manage the overall team portfolio, defining processes and “ways we work” within the team, leading various internal and cross-functional initiatives, working directly with technical resources, owning ongoing operational processes, and delivering executive briefings. This role is not synonymous with a typical “project/program manager”, but combines experience as a technical resource, program manager, product owner, and/or manager of a technical team to help drive the overall execution.

Title: Manager, QA Project Management, IT Systems, and Operational Excellence
Job_Description:
Purpose
The Agile Transformation Coach, Lead role is responsible for developing, planning, leading, scoping, analysis, and execution of an Agile strategy across a single organization or a single/subset of an organizations Delivery Teams. The role will ensure that Delivery Team is consistently and continuously applying the use of Agile frameworks and methods. The role will partner the organization leaders to drive strategic Agile Transformation in support of transformational goals and business metrics.
Responsibilities
Promote the success of Agile in the organization through engaging leaders and stakeholders providing progress reports to leaders on Agile expansion, blockers, and successes.

Title: Manager, QA Project Management, IT Systems, and Operational Excellence
Job_Description:
Purpose:
The Senior Agile Transformation Coach serves as an accelerator for the adoption of Agile ways of working within their organization. This role will provide training and coaching to build maturity in Agile approaches as well as guide multiple delivery teams within their organization as they transition from traditional work styles into an Agile mindset, behaviors, practices, and frameworks: Scrum, Kanban and a Scaled Agile. The role will measure progress to overcome obstacles and drive continuous improvement and champion Agile to stakeholders.

Responsibilities:
Develop, deliver, and/or coordinate with external providers to provision training and workshops on agile frameworks (e.g., Scrum, Kanban, Scaled Agile Framework) and practices (e.g., conducting daily stand-ups, retrospectives, backlog management).

Title: Manager, QA Project Management, IT Systems, and Operational Excellence
Job_Description:
This position reports into the Office of the PST (part of the Strategy Management Office) in the Pharmacovigilance and Patient Safety (PPS) organization. The PPS organization works collaboratively and strategically with colleagues across the product lifecycle to identify, evaluate, understand and communicate the safety profile of our drugs to protect patients worldwide.
The Product Safety Team Project Management group (PST PM) plays a critical role in shaping and driving the strategic priorities of the PST through providing exceptional and strategic project management leadership. The PST is a high-profile high-impact team that leads and owns safety decisions and strategy across the product lifecycle. The team partners with stakeholders across the product lifecycle to provide innovative safety-driven strategies, which will maximize product benefit-risk for patients.
Key Responsibilities Include:

Title: Associate Director, COE Operations
Job_Description:
SUMMARY
The Associate Director, IT position will provide leadership to oversee, manage and develop the Center of Excellence that creates, maintains, enhances and supports internally developed applications that support AbbVie’s R&D organization. Key objectives include management of vendor resources, development and enforcement of technology standards used by the COE, management of the use of the DevOps platform by the COE, oversight and continuous improvement of the agile methodology used by the COE, financial management the COE, and management of the COE demand backlog. The position will work directly with Finance, Security, Architecture and Executive IT management to establish COE financial management, COE security adherence, architectural and tech debt management, and COE demand management.
Primary Responsibilities:

Title: Associate Director, COE Operations
Job_Description:
AbbVie Information Security is looking for a highly motivated and talented individual to join the Cyber Security Engineering (CSE) Team. The Cyber Security Engineering installs, manages, optimizes, automates the tools in use by the broader Information Security and Risk Management teams.
Data Management services are a foundation for the CSE team’s portfolio, inclusive of data transformations and pipelining to downstream systems. The CSE team acts as subject matter experts and assists with training and development of their userbase, expanding beyond the scope of Information Security and Risk Management.
This is an expansion of capabilities within the Cyber Security Engineering Team, focusing on the data pipelines, data models, and adherence to standards across our datasets. Grow with us as a Senior Data Engineer, Cyber Security Engineering (CSE) to raise our tools and skilled analysts up so that they may help our business to continue to have remarkable impacts on people’s lives.

Title: Associate Director, COE Operations
Job_Description:
As a Network discipline expert and contact, drives functional performance by designing and implementing business technology solutions aimed at enabling and accelerating delivery of new or improved products. Technical leader acting at group, department, and cross‐functional levels. Responsible for managing the Network Technology architectures and tying them to the Enterprise Architecture and other architectures.
Responsibilities:
Generates high quality artifacts such as architectural and capabilities roadmaps, requirements, high level and detailed designs and deployment plans.
Works with cross-functional teams, support the assessment and implementation of new technologies, their viability, and related risks, and create initial points of view followed by recommendations on how they should be leveraged to enable and protect the environment.

Title: Associate Director, COE Operations
Job_Description:
The Finance Manager for Third Party Manufacturing (TPM) will provide financial leadership, business expertise, guidance and support for the Oncology & Neurology brands. More specifically, the Finance Manager will partner closely with the broader Third Party Manufacturing, and Supply Chain teams to ensure that Imbruvica and our Neurology brands are available for our patients, all internal controls are applied appropriately, and insightful financial analysis is provided to achieve strategic and day-to-day business objectives.

CORE JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
Financial Reporting & Analysis – Actuals Processes and Reporting:
Review and approve monthly Oncology TPM Product and Project accruals, reclasses and various cost allocation journal entries, in partnership with Finance Shared Services.

Title: Associate Director, COE Operations
Job_Description:
Myticas's direct client based out of North Chicago, IL is currently seeking an Information Security Analyst - Penetration for a 100% remote contract position.
Top Skills:
bull; Experience in application PEN testing
bull; Familiarly with OWASP Top 10
bull; Well organized and good at communicating
Job Description:
Role Description
Information Security is looking for a highly motivated, diligent, and skillful analyst to join the Attack Surface Management (ASM) team. Application Security team protects patients, data, and brand by identifying vulnerabilities and threats to our organization and working to drive remediation of identified security risks. Application Security is a capability of ASM within the larger Cyber Security Operations (CSO) function. Join us as Senior Security Analyst, Application Security, to support and improve our efforts to identify and reduce AbbVie's attack surface and help our business continue to have remarkable impacts on people's lives.

The Senior Security Analyst is a key member of the Application Security team and works with internal and external groups to identify and drive remediation of information security risks across all AbbVie application environments. The Application Security Analyst will:

The ideal candidate must have prior experience leading manual web and mobile application security penetration tests within an enterprise environment and working with application stakeholders to discuss vulnerabilities and remediation options.



bull; Maintain awareness of the latest critical information security vulnerabilities, threats, and exploits
bull; Provide guidance on existing and emerging threats in the web and mobile application space.
bull; Perform application security reviews throughout the application development lifecycle, including tasks such as:
o Performing manual security assessments for web and mobile applications across the enterprise
o Static (SAST) Manual Dynamic (DAST) application security testing and/or penetration testing of applications and source code
o Auditing results of security assessments with development and/or security teams and offering plans for remediation of vulnerabilities
bull; Communicate technical application security concepts to customers, including developers, architects, and managers
bull; Participate in the management of bug bounty program, working to validate and triage reported vulnerabilities and work with application owners to ensure valid findings are remediated
bull; Train customer staff on application security and remediation of application security code defects
bull; Identify and develop secure software development best practices
bull; Identify enhancements to tools, standards, and processes; provide input into policies and procedures, and contribute to the implementation and refinement of the strategy for the Application Risk program on a global basis
bull; Guide and mentor other members of the application security team, which involves troubleshooting testing-related issues, knowledge sharing, and help with testing-related activities
bull; Experience with testing and exploitation of applications using cloud technologies such as AWS, Azure, GCP



bull; Demonstrated advanced knowledge of web application vulnerabilities and web application business logic flaws and threats
bull; Demonstrated advanced understanding of application architectures and technologies, including web applications, mobile technology, data encryption, and identity and access management.
bull; Advanced hands-on experience with manual vulnerability testing and static code analysis
bull; Advanced experience with tools including, but not limited to, Kali Linux platform and built-in tools, Burp Suite, and OWASP ZAP
bull; Strong Hands-On experience with testing and exploitation of iOS and Android applications, which includes static, dynamic analysis and reversing of the apps.
bull; Experience with at least one of the Scripting languages (python, PowerShell, bash, etc.) and automation
bull; In-depth understanding, testing and exploitation of Web APIs and related components
bull; Candidate must have an advanced understanding of security controls such as Authentication, Authorization, Access Control, Cryptography, and Network Protocols along with security standards: OWASP Top 10, SANS 25, NIST, and CVE
bull; Written and verbal communication skills are critical
bull; Adept at communicating concepts to diverse audiences with varying skill sets.
bull; Certification such as OSCP, OSWE, GWAPT, or GPEN is a plus
bull; Education Experience - Minimum of one of the following:
o No college degree and 8 years of IT experience with 6 years in a specialized information security role
o Bachelor's Degree in computer science or related technical field and 6 years of IT experience
o Bachelor's Degree in computer science or related technical field and 5 years of specialized information security experience
o Master's Degree in computer science or related technical field and 4 years of specialized information security experience

Title: Associate Director, COE Operations
Job_Description:
The Data Lake Architect will be working in a global environment with a team of Data Engineers that is integrating AbbVie's data in a modern, scalable, cloud-based environment. This role is responsible for curating content to support key business initiatives, working primarily with data analysts across functional disciplines. The Data Lake Architect participates in the acquisition, cataloging, and modeling of information aligned with the needs of business stakeholders and supports data consumers in understanding information context and effectively utilizing advanced analytic tools.
The Data Lake Architect drives standards and best practices to ensure consistency, is accountable for gathering cross-functional input and identifies opportunities for automation to scale advanced analytics capabilities. The Data Lake Architect role is a key technical leadership role to enable application of advanced analytics techniques across commercial processes bringing technology and/or data and insights to the forefront of decision making via fit-for-purpose data analytics solutions.

Title: Disaster Recovery Systems Engineer
Job_Description:
Elicits and communicates the organization’s business strategy; works directly with business unit clients to understand specific business processes and needs and opportunities for improvement; identifies IT capabilities and information required to support the business processes and collaborates in the development of appropriate information management strategies, developing them as an integrated part of the business strategy.
Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures.
Identifies current and emerging business needs and evaluates alternative technology solutions using standard information systems methodologies and best practices. Proactively seek out strategic business opportunities with business unit executives for the application of new or existing technology capabilities.
Develops technology strategies that meet the requirements of the business. Identifies the business benefits of alternative strategies. Ensures compliance between business strategies and technology directions. Prepares testing plans to confirm that requirements and system design are accurate and complete.

Title: Disaster Recovery Systems Engineer
Job_Description: The Senior Electrical Test Engineer will be responsible for planning, performing and documenting system verification and integration activities of complex electro-mechanical medical devices with software. It includes testing of specified components and overall product functionality to ensure product safety and efficacy. The engineer is experienced in all aspects of product development life cycle with strong understanding of systems engineering processes in a regulated industry. The Senior Electrical Test Engineer will work with a multi-disciplinary engineering teams including system, software, electrical, and mechanical design engineers, and other functions to ensure highest quality for class II medical devices. We are looking for a motivated self-starter who is energetic, has a ‘make it happen in a compliant way’ attitude and can thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Title: Disaster Recovery Systems Engineer
Job_Description:
Work collaboratively with technology and business groups to conceive, design, engineer, and implement data, software, and technology solutions that solve significant scientific or business problems. Investigate, identify, and implement state-of-the-art technology platforms that drive productivity and efficiency gains in own function and throughout multiple business areas. Contribute to advancement of technology in area of expertise. Develop productive collaborations and communications with other groups across multiple disciplines. Technology Engineers will be aligned to a specific area: Information, Software, Data, or Infrastructure. This role will be focused on infrastructure reporting into the network engineering team.
Responsibilities:
Conceive, design, engineer, and implement data, software, or technology solutions by studying information needs; conferring with users; studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes; investigating problem areas; Routinely demonstrate initiative and creativity in developing technology solutions.

Title: Disaster Recovery Systems Engineer
Job_Description:
The Senior Mechanical Test Engineer will be responsible for planning, performing and documenting system verification, integration and validation activities of complex electro-mechanical systems with software. It includes testing of requirements for electro-mechanical systems to ensure proper product components and product functionality. The engineer is experienced in all aspects of product development life cycle with strong understanding of systems engineering processes in a regulated industry. The Senior Mechanical Test Engineer will work with a multi-disciplinary engineering teams including software, electrical, and mechanical design and test engineers, and other functions to ensure high quality product introductions for class II medical devices. We are looking for a motivated self-starter who is energetic, has a ‘make it happen in a compliant way’ attitude and can thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Responsibilities:
Lead the mechanical test engineering activities for complex electro-mechanical medical device products within the Product Development team

Title: Disaster Recovery Systems Engineer
Job_Description: The AbbVie Combination Product Development (CPD) function provides design and development expertise to enable drug delivery systems for AbbVie pharmaceuticals. The Human Factors (HF) group within CPD manages the drug delivery device user interface design process and executes usability assessments required to support the successful submission of AbbVie Combination Products. The combination of an increase in the number of drugs that require a delivery device, the recent addition of medical devices to AbbVie’s portfolio, and increasing engagement of Human-Centered Design and HF skills in early-stage clinical development drive the need for additional Human Factors expertise.

Title: Disaster Recovery Systems Engineer
Job_Description:
Scope: We are looking for an enthusiastic Senior Linux Systems Engineer to partner alongside our System Architects with day-to-day Linux operations and join our dynamic and growing global Scientific Linux team. This person will be responsible for engineering a global Linux platform supporting R & D Scientists globally.
About us:
Our team includes highly talented and creative professionals supporting the broader visions and goals of AbbVie
We operate in highly matrixed teams working together with R&D.
We focus on people: we value inclusivity and diversity
We are located in a new custom-built facility for AbbVie centered at the birthplace of Biotechnology in South San Francisco

Title: Disaster Recovery Systems Engineer
Job_Description:
Conceive, design, engineer, and implement enterprise-level data, software, and technology solutions that solve significant scientific or business problems. Generate new proposals and lead those efforts. Investigate, identify, and implement state-of-the-art technology platforms that drive productivity and efficiency gains in own function and throughout multiple business areas. Act as a lead in his/her area of expertise and critically evaluate relevant technological advances and integrate this knowledge into new business technology solutions. Technology Engineers will be aligned to a specific area: Information, Software, Data, or Infrastructure.
Responsibilities:
Effectively function as a principle engineer, generating new technological proposals and leading those efforts. Anticipate and critically evaluate technological advances or competitive threats and respond with appropriate new strategies.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Data Science and Analytics is an ambitious team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers with a unique blend of Business, Scientific, and Machine Learning expertise that seeks to unleash the full potential of AbbVie’s data assets by bringing technology and/or data and insights to the forefront of decision making via fit-for-purpose solutions.
The Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data (RWD) Analytics role is a key role to enable application of advanced analytics techniques across clinical development processes. Leverages subject matter expertise across RWD assets to generate RWD insights to support clinical trial strategy, feasibility, and operational decision-making processes. Design, structure, and deliver custom reports and presentations for clinical development teams. Drives Analytics innovation and experimentation to enable data-driven insights for complex business problems across R&D by deploying advanced analytics techniques like Machine Learning and Visual Analytics. Identifies use cases that are appropriate for the application of ML and AI.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Senior Scientist I – Machine Learning/Cheminformatics
Here is an opportunity to work with the best of the best at the intersection of machine learning, deep learning, cheminformatics, and drug discovery to make a remarkable pan-abbvie impact by enabling people to lead longer and healthier lives. As a Senior Machine Learning Scientist, you will work as part of AbbVie’s Information Research RAIDERS: Pharma Discovery team in conjunction with our partners across early as well as late drug Discovery and Developmental Sciences departments. You will bring together the power of domain science and technology at the interface of cheminformatics, data engineering, and machine learning techniques to generate new understanding of the drug discovery process that contributes to finding faster and better drug discovery pipeline. In this opportunity you will work as part of a highly capable team helping to bridge together domain specialists in medicinal chemistry, drug modelers, cheminformatics, and Developmental Scientists along with machine and deep learning scientist to extract insights from diverse data. You will apply your established technical skills and experience with machine and deep learning techniques to deliver solutions capable of providing true insights that push forward the fundamental understanding of drug discovery process. You will utilize your notable consulting mindset to bridge the communication gaps between domain scientists and technologists. You will bring your solution architecture expertise to help design, develop, and deliver models and tools that extract and generate these insights. Come join us to help discover the next new drug discovery pipeline and help save lives.

Title: Enterprise Cloud Engineering Director
Job_Description:
AbbVie is looking for a highly motived leader that will be responsible for the engineering, implementation, and operations of cloud services in a multi-cloud environment. The ideal candidate will have a solid understand of cloud computing involving multiple disciplines and collaborate with business units to provide consultation and support for cloud solutions with a focus on best practices and security for all cloud services and solutions. This role will also be expected to investigate and engineer new technologies focused on automation to enhance and secure the cloud platforms and provide agility to the business.
Responsibilities
Reviews architectural diagrams for proposed solutions and implements the standard cloud or on prem services based on compute, data, or security requirements.
Lead Engineering and implement native or hybrid multi-tiered cloud applications to the public cloud.

Title: Enterprise Cloud Engineering Director
Job_Description: The Senior Electrical Test Engineer will be responsible for planning, performing and documenting system verification and integration activities of complex electro-mechanical medical devices with software. It includes testing of specified components and overall product functionality to ensure product safety and efficacy. The engineer is experienced in all aspects of product development life cycle with strong understanding of systems engineering processes in a regulated industry. The Senior Electrical Test Engineer will work with a multi-disciplinary engineering teams including system, software, electrical, and mechanical design engineers, and other functions to ensure highest quality for class II medical devices. We are looking for a motivated self-starter who is energetic, has a ‘make it happen in a compliant way’ attitude and can thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Title: Enterprise Cloud Engineering Director
Job_Description:
Purpose:
The packaging technology engineer is a global role which drives continuous improvement and optimization programs across the IME global packaging network. This role provides packaging technology solution leadership and cross-functional management of serialization, network performance, factory of the future and network optimization programs. The role liaises with multiple stakeholders including site automation, enterprise applications, information security, engineering and supply chain to ensure successful delivery of packaging roadmap. In partnership with site, regional and global organizations, the packaging technology engineer contributes to planning and execution of packaging projects that deliver innovation and enablement of IME’s factory of the future, segmentation, simplification and network optimization business imperatives. Lastly, this role is an active and contributing member of the global IME packaging governance team, advocating on behalf of and contributing subject matter expertise to a global network of 10 packaging sites across the Americas and Europe.

Title: Contractor-Risk Management Security Specialist
Job_Description:
Genmab is focused on the creation and development of innovative and differentiated antibody products, with the aim of improving the lives of cancer patients.
Genmab is on an exciting journey! In just a brief time we have evolved from a R&D (Research & Development) company, which licensed its products for partners to market, to an end-to-end Biotechnology company with full commercialization capabilities, and we will shortly be bringing our products directly to our customers. Having partnerships with AbbVie, Seagen, and BioNTech, and a full clinical program with multiple products in Phase 3, these are exciting times. Clearly Genmab is on track to achieve our vision that “By 2025, our own product has transformed cancer treatment, and we have a pipeline of knock-your-socks-off antibodies.”
Genmab is looking for a talented and motivated Risk Management Security Specialist.
Responsibilities
Continuously assess supply chain security risks based on an inventory of vendor landscape and supply chain security and compliance risks for IT&D

Title: Enterprise Cloud Engineering Director
Job_Description:
AbbVie is looking for a highly motived leader that will be responsible for the engineering, implementation, and operations of cloud services in a multi-cloud environment. The ideal candidate will have a solid understand of cloud computing involving multiple disciplines and collaborate with business units to provide consultation and support for cloud solutions with a focus on best practices and security for all cloud services and solutions. This role will also be expected to investigate and engineer new technologies focused on automation to enhance and secure the cloud platforms and provide agility to the business.
Responsibilities
Reviews architectural diagrams for proposed solutions and implements the standard cloud or on prem services based on compute, data, or security requirements.
Lead Engineering and implement native or hybrid multi-tiered cloud applications to the public cloud.

Title: Enterprise Cloud Engineering Director
Job_Description:
Senior Scientist I – Machine Learning/Cheminformatics
Here is an opportunity to work with the best of the best at the intersection of machine learning, deep learning, cheminformatics, and drug discovery to make a remarkable pan-abbvie impact by enabling people to lead longer and healthier lives. As a Senior Machine Learning Scientist, you will work as part of AbbVie’s Information Research RAIDERS: Pharma Discovery team in conjunction with our partners across early as well as late drug Discovery and Developmental Sciences departments. You will bring together the power of domain science and technology at the interface of cheminformatics, data engineering, and machine learning techniques to generate new understanding of the drug discovery process that contributes to finding faster and better drug discovery pipeline. In this opportunity you will work as part of a highly capable team helping to bridge together domain specialists in medicinal chemistry, drug modelers, cheminformatics, and Developmental Scientists along with machine and deep learning scientist to extract insights from diverse data. You will apply your established technical skills and experience with machine and deep learning techniques to deliver solutions capable of providing true insights that push forward the fundamental understanding of drug discovery process. You will utilize your notable consulting mindset to bridge the communication gaps between domain scientists and technologists. You will bring your solution architecture expertise to help design, develop, and deliver models and tools that extract and generate these insights. Come join us to help discover the next new drug discovery pipeline and help save lives.

Title: Enterprise Cloud Engineering Director
Job_Description:
Data Science and Analytics is an ambitious team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers with a unique blend of Business, Scientific, and Machine Learning expertise that seeks to unleash the full potential of AbbVie’s data assets by bringing technology and/or data and insights to the forefront of decision making via fit-for-purpose solutions.
The Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data (RWD) Analytics role is a key role to enable application of advanced analytics techniques across clinical development processes. Leverages subject matter expertise across RWD assets to generate RWD insights to support clinical trial strategy, feasibility, and operational decision-making processes. Design, structure, and deliver custom reports and presentations for clinical development teams. Drives Analytics innovation and experimentation to enable data-driven insights for complex business problems across R&D by deploying advanced analytics techniques like Machine Learning and Visual Analytics. Identifies use cases that are appropriate for the application of ML and AI.

Title: Enterprise Cloud Engineering Director
Job_Description:
Work collaboratively with technology and business groups to conceive, design, engineer, and implement data, software, and technology solutions that solve significant scientific or business problems. Investigate, identify, and implement state-of-the-art technology platforms that drive productivity and efficiency gains in own function and throughout multiple business areas. Contribute to advancement of technology in area of expertise. Develop productive collaborations and communications with other groups across multiple disciplines. Technology Engineers will be aligned to a specific area: Information, Software, Data, or Infrastructure. This role will be focused on infrastructure reporting into the network engineering team.
Responsibilities:
Conceive, design, engineer, and implement data, software, or technology solutions by studying information needs; conferring with users; studying systems flow, data usage, and work processes; investigating problem areas; Routinely demonstrate initiative and creativity in developing technology solutions.

Title: Enterprise Cloud Engineering Director
Job_Description:
Scope: We are looking for an enthusiastic Senior Linux Systems Engineer to partner alongside our System Architects with day-to-day Linux operations and join our dynamic and growing global Scientific Linux team. This person will be responsible for engineering a global Linux platform supporting R & D Scientists globally.
About us:
Our team includes highly talented and creative professionals supporting the broader visions and goals of AbbVie
We operate in highly matrixed teams working together with R&D.
We focus on people: we value inclusivity and diversity
We are located in a new custom-built facility for AbbVie centered at the birthplace of Biotechnology in South San Francisco

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Data Science and Analytics is an ambitious team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers with a unique blend of Business, Scientific, and Machine Learning expertise that seeks to unleash the full potential of AbbVie’s data assets by bringing technology and/or data and insights to the forefront of decision making via fit-for-purpose solutions.
The Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data (RWD) Analytics role is a key role to enable application of advanced analytics techniques across clinical development processes. Leverages subject matter expertise across RWD assets to generate RWD insights to support clinical trial strategy, feasibility, and operational decision-making processes. Design, structure, and deliver custom reports and presentations for clinical development teams. Drives Analytics innovation and experimentation to enable data-driven insights for complex business problems across R&D by deploying advanced analytics techniques like Machine Learning and Visual Analytics. Identifies use cases that are appropriate for the application of ML and AI.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
The Real-World Data (RWD) team focuses on supporting insights generation and sharing of insights within our data. Data collected include, but are not limited to, clinical and economic outcomes, patient-reported outcomes, and health-related quality of life. All teams in R&D can benefit from real world data and our team is tasked to make the data integration, applications, and project process seamless for researchers and scientists. RWD team works across multiple data assets to bring a curated picture of insights to the business so experts can spend time extracting knowledge. RWD experts hope to share knowledge with asset teams and develop wisdom that can be shared external to AbbVie and make a remarkable impact on patient lives.
Responsibilities
Partners with R&D teams to understand, influence and enable short and long-term solution needs and helps execute strategies to address those needs

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Senior Data Scientist
Purpose Statement:
We are looking for a Data Scientist to analyze large amounts of raw information to find patterns that will help improve the data to insights journey for our US Commercial Organization. We will rely on you to build data products to extract valuable business insights. In this role, you should be highly analytical with a knack for analysis, math and statistics. Critical thinking and problem-solving skills are essential for interpreting data. We want to see a passion for machine-learning and research. Your goal will be to help our company analyze trends to make better decisions.
What you’ll be doing:
The Manager, Data Science will be responsible for designing, executing and socializing analytical solutions to business problems across Abbvie. You will apply statistics, machine learning, and operations research techniques to enhance efforts in generating revenue, driving efficiencies, identifying cost savings, and developing products. You will work closely with IT and business stakeholders to develop analytical tools and foster the practice of data science. A candidate for this position should not only be skillful in quantitative methodologies and programming, but also have keen business acumen. The ability to work in a diverse team and the willingness to learn are key to this role.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Purpose:
Business Technology Solutions (BTS) Analytics & Information Strategy is an ambitious team of curious data and analytics professionals on a mission to elevate decision-making by AbbVie BTS leadership through timely and relevant insights. We uncover opportunities for BTS by digging into data to find the “why” and “what can we do about it?” We focus on the highest priority challenges for BTS, saying no when needed to protect time during regular working hours for deep analytical creativity and collaborative problem solving. We challenge ourselves to continuously improve the insights we deliver, learning from each other and insights teams across AbbVie.

You will succeed as the Director - Business Intelligence & Data Science if you are enthusiastic about applying advanced analytics techniques to the diverse questions and challenges facing BTS leadership, driving analytics innovation and experimentation to enable data-driven insights for complex business problems across BTS. You are comfortable using your deep expertise in prescriptive & predictive analytics, root cause analysis, data mining and exploratory insight generation to shape the implementation of data science techniques in novel contexts, iterating until that Eureka moment where you’ve unlocked the insight needed to solve the problem. You know that garbage in will mean garbage out, so you ensure data integrity and quality before you or your team starts an analysis, and coach junior team members on their data quality mindset. While you’re creative when you need to be, you don’t reinvent the wheel unnecessarily, and ensure consistent analysis techniques are used when comparability matters. You are energized by the breadth of potential advanced analytics use cases across optimization of employee experiences, forecasting, value optimization, talent development, talent acquisition, and brand building.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Purpose:
Describe the primary goals, objectives or functions or outputs of this position.
The Data Scientist is the main driver behind advanced analytics supporting supply chain processes. The successful Data Scientist will translate business needs into analytic questions; conduct data exploration and model specification; design and perform rigorous analyses of operational, customer, and financial data; and translate these analytic findings into leading information for our business partners. The chosen candidate would act as an advisor for executive and management level decision makers. This individual would also provide direction to IT on data governance and industry best practices with a lens towards agility and efficiency.
Responsibilities:

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
About AbbVie
AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.
Position Overview:
AbbVie’s global Information Research (IR) group has a mission to unlock information that makes cures possible. Within IR, the AbbVie Library Information Science (LIS) team builds tools and provides services that help AbbVie scientists interact with, manage, and consume knowledge from scientific literature and other sources to foster innovation in drug discovery and development. LIS is a global organization, with a presence at the Lake County, Illinois headquarters, Boston, MA and Irvine, CA areas (US) and the Ludwigshafen site (Germany). We leverage leading technologies and methods to provide AbbVie scientists with our industry’s best capabilities around literature-based knowledge discovery. Our team has the scientific and technical competence to use a very large number of knowledge sources to provide high quality answers to our customers.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Purpose:
Data Science and Analytics is an ambitious team of Data Scientists and Data Engineers with a unique blend of Business, Scientific, and Machine Learning expertise that seeks to unleash the full potential of AbbVie’s data assets by bringing technology and/or data and insights to the forefront of decision making via fit-for-purpose solutions.
The Senior Data Scientist, Business Analytics role is a key role to enable application of advanced analytics techniques across clinical development processes. Translates business and operational challenges into data-driven insights and experimental questions. Drives Analytics innovation and experimentation to enable data-driven insights for complex business problems across R&D by deploying advanced analytics techniques like Machine Learning and Visual Analytics. Identifies use cases that are appropriate for the application of ML and AI.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Senior Scientist I – Machine Learning/Cheminformatics
Here is an opportunity to work with the best of the best at the intersection of machine learning, deep learning, cheminformatics, and drug discovery to make a remarkable pan-abbvie impact by enabling people to lead longer and healthier lives. As a Senior Machine Learning Scientist, you will work as part of AbbVie’s Information Research RAIDERS: Pharma Discovery team in conjunction with our partners across early as well as late drug Discovery and Developmental Sciences departments. You will bring together the power of domain science and technology at the interface of cheminformatics, data engineering, and machine learning techniques to generate new understanding of the drug discovery process that contributes to finding faster and better drug discovery pipeline. In this opportunity you will work as part of a highly capable team helping to bridge together domain specialists in medicinal chemistry, drug modelers, cheminformatics, and Developmental Scientists along with machine and deep learning scientist to extract insights from diverse data. You will apply your established technical skills and experience with machine and deep learning techniques to deliver solutions capable of providing true insights that push forward the fundamental understanding of drug discovery process. You will utilize your notable consulting mindset to bridge the communication gaps between domain scientists and technologists. You will bring your solution architecture expertise to help design, develop, and deliver models and tools that extract and generate these insights. Come join us to help discover the next new drug discovery pipeline and help save lives.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Want to join an award-winning team? We OFFER that.
Ready to make a Worldwide impact? We OFFER that too.
Want to have a thriving career? We OFFER that.
Ready to drive innovation? We OFFER that too.

Welcome to AbbVie!
At AbbVie, we offer you the resources and a global reach to empower your innovative mindset. From day one, we have known it takes teamwork and collaboration to develop the scientific breakthroughs, innovative pipelines, and therapies that change millions of patients’ lives around the world. In short, we know it takes “you” to make those ground-breaking advancements happen. We take pride in serving and supporting our communities and protecting the environment, making a lasting impact that is felt within healthcare and beyond.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
*This position can be remote*
Purpose:
This position partners with cross functional stakeholders in support of the product safety profile and benefit risk throughout product lifecycle through signal detection, signal evaluation, and preparation of written and verbal summaries of signal management activities and risks to patient safety to present to senior management and regulatory authorities globally.
Responsibilities:
Responsible for standard surveillance activities for a product’s life cycle (one or more assigned compounds and products) through review of safety data from clinical trials, safety databases, and the literature.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Purpose:
The Senior Statistical Analyst is a key role in the research and development of new pharmaceutical products.
The Senior Statistical Analyst of CPPM programming independently performs programming activities for complex, heterogeneous assets and closely communicates with pharmacometricians and clinical pharmacologists.
The Senior Statistical Analyst works on improving existing workflows and mentors Statistical Programmers and Statistical Analysts.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Protocols: Direct development of statistical designs and analysis procedures for scientific protocols, ensuring they are scientifically sound, aligned with project strategy, meet regulatory objectives and make optimal use of the data to be collected. Ensure statistical analysis plan is methodologically sound and consistent with objectives of the protocol. Assist in developing project and functional standards of data collection and analysis, and implement these standards.
Database Activities: Collaborate with Data Sciences, Statistical Programming and other stakeholders to ensure data collection instruments and database implementation meets short and long-term project needs. Contribute to data monitoring plans. Develop and implement project-specific data standards. Ensure accuracy and consistency of data released for statistical analysis.
Statistical Analyses: Demonstrate extensive understanding of statistical concepts and methodology. Propose novel statistical methodological approaches leading to improvement in the efficiency and sensitivity of study results. Provide sufficient detail to allow programming implementation. Ensure that all statistical analyses specified in scientific protocols and analysis plans are conducted appropriately. Determine need for development of novel statistical methodology.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description: The Senior Data Analyst will perform various functions, including data collection and analysis to identify useful trends and provide management with relevant information that will facilitate informed decisions in the US Commercial Patient Services & Data – Business Technology Solutions (BTS) group. This role will involve analyzing and interpreting collected data using statistical tools. The Senior Data Analyst will interpret raw data and identify patterns to provide clarity to non-technical audience. This position will also create visualizations, including dashboards, flowcharts, and graphs to relay business concepts through visuals to colleagues and other relevant stakeholders. The Senior Data Analyst will be required to be involved in coding and generating reports along with identifying patterns in Commercial data lake and Datawarehouse environments and develop an understanding of U.S. Patient Services datasets and build strong working relationships with cross functional teams (Patient Services, BTS, MABI, and Compliance).

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Purpose:
This positing is for a senior level experienced Data Architect to conceive, design, engineer, and help implement data, analytic and integration solutions to meet cross enterprise business needs. This position will investigate, identify, and implement state-of-the-art data management, analytic and integration technology platforms that drive cross functional productivity, efficiency, and insights. Creates and drives adoption of enterprise‐wide architecture and roadmaps focused on data integration, APIs, Advanced Analytics, Big Data Platforms/Elastic Scale, Analytics and other data centric technologies.


Responsibilities:

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
The US Commercial Business Technology Solutions is looking for a Data Science Architect who is responsible for the planning, coordination, and successful deployments of US Commercial Data Lake project deliveries and building capabilities across AbbVie brands, and functions. This role will coordinate with IT Business Relationship Managers, Business Consultants, Solution Architects, Technical Leads, Developers, Business Analysts, PMO, business stakeholders, and System Integrator(s) to drive the US Commercial solutions through end-to-end delivery and completion.
The Data Science Architect works closely with Data and System Integrator(s) to ensure alignment of key project activities and milestones for deployment and solution delivery. This position would establish and lead Data Science Architecture at AbbVie and would act as an advisor for all advanced analytics initiatives across business functions. This is an opportunity to build the strategy and vision for data science, AI/ML, and predictive/prescriptive analytics for the enterprise. We are looking for a technology enthusiast who could interpret and correlate multi-functional data sets to solve complex business problems.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Purpose
The Senior Research Statistician is responsible for providing statistical support to the research and development organizations for drug discovery, target identification/verification, non-clinical and clinical biomarker exploration to characterize subgroups of patients or markers of disease progression and treatment response for precision medicine. The Senior Research Statistician works under supervision to support discovery researchers, translational scientists and clinicians in the design, collection, analysis and reporting of multi-dimensional biomarker data from Discovery to late stage clinical development to enable objective decision-making for each drug development program.
Major Job Responsibilities
Collaborating with discovery and translational biomarker scientists and clinicians and contribute to design, analysis and reporting of biomarker and assay studies in association with early and late phase clinical trials. The typical analysis includes pharmacodynamic biomarker analysis, safety biomarker analysis, prognostic and predictive biomarker identification and development, bioassay and companion diagnostic test development, patient subgroup identification based on biomarkers and clinical variables.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Protocols: Directs the development of statistical designs and analysis procedures for scientific protocols, ensuring they are scientifically sound, aligned with project strategy, meet regulatory objectives and make optimal use of the data to be collected. Ensure statistical analysis plan is methodologically sound and consistent with objectives of the protocol. Develop project and functional standards of data collection and analysis, and implement these standards.
Database Activities: Collaborate with Data Sciences, Statistical Programming and other stakeholders to ensure data collection instruments and database implementation meets short and long-term project needs. Guide development and implementation of project-specific data standards. Guide and ensure timely execution of all database-related DSS activities for project.
Statistical Analyses: Demonstrate excellent understanding of statistical concepts and methodology. Propose novel statistical methodological approaches leading to improvements in the efficiency and sensitivity of study results. Provide sufficient detail to allow programming implementation. Ensure that all statistical analyses specified in scientific protocols and analysis plans are conducted appropriately. Determine need for development of novel statistical methodology.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Purpose
The Statistical Analyst is an integral role in the research and development of new pharmaceutical products. The primary responsibilities for this role include the analysis and reporting of clinical trial data without supervision for routine activities and with supervision for more complex activities. The Statistical Analyst interfaces with Statistics, Data Sciences and Clinical Operations.

Job Responsibilities
Leads the statistical programming activities for routine studies.
Develop SAS programs for the creation of ADaM data sets following CDISC standards.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Job Description
About AbbVie
AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Purpose
The Associate Director of Statistics provides scientific and statistical leadership for assigned clinical development projects. A visible and collaborative role that works in partnership with clinical and regulatory experts to advance medicines to our patients.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Introduction:
The Senior Statistician/ Manager, Statistics provides statistical expertise to support the research and development organization. Specific areas of work may include clinical trials, patient safety, and global medical affairs. The candidate works independently in partnership with experts in multiple disciplines to advance medicines to our patients.

Responsibilities:
Provide expertise to design, analysis and reporting of clinical trials or other scientific research studies. Independently develop protocols and/or statistical analysis plans (or product safety analysis plans/integrated summary of safety analysis plans/analysis plans for GMA evidence generation) with details for programming implementation. Implement sound statistical methodology in scientific investigations.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
Purpose
The Senior Manager of Statistical Programming is a leadership role which manages a team of statistical programmers in the research and development of new pharmaceutical products. The Senior Manager of Statistical Programming is responsible for leading the statistical programming activities for one or more compounds/indications or a therapeutic area. This role must effectively interface with Statistics, Data Sciences, Medical Writing, Regulatory Publishing and Development Operations.

Responsibilities
Leads the statistical programming activities for one or more compounds/indications or a therapeutic area.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
The Manager of Statistical Programming is a strategic role which guides a team of Statistical
Programmers in the research and development of new pharmaceutical products. This role is directly
responsible for leading the statistical programming activities for a compound/indication or
therapeutic area in early development. The Manager of Statistical Programming must effectively
interface with Statistics, Data Sciences, Medical Writing, Regulatory Publishing and Clinical
Operations.

Leads the statistical programming activities for a compound/indication or therapeutic area in early
development.
Leads a team of statistical programmers and manages the resource planning for assigned staff.
Ensures timely deliverables, that all quality processes are followed and consistency within the
projects.
Develops and oversees the development of SAS programs for the creation of ADaM data sets
following CDISC standards.
Develops and oversees the development of SAS programs for the creation of Tables, Listings and
Figures.
Ensures consistency of ADaM data sets for individual studies and integrated data.
Creates documentation for regulatory filings including reviewers guides and data definition
documents.
Leads the development of standard SAS Macros and participates in the development of standard
operating procedures.
Provides oversight and mentoring of assigned Statistical Programmers, Statistical Analysts and
Senior Statistical Analysts.

MS in Statistics, Computer Science or a related field with 8+ years of relevant experience. OR BS
in Statistics, Computer Science or a related field with 10+ years of relevant experience.
Previous experience leading a team of statistical programmers.
In-depth understanding of SAS programming concepts and techniques related to drug
development.
In-depth understanding of CDISC Standards.
In-depth understanding of the drug development process, including experience with regulatory
filings.
Ability to communicate clearly both oral and written.
Ability to effectively represent the Statistical Programming Organization in cross functional teams.
Ability to accurately estimate effort required for project related programming activities.

statistical programmers in the research and development of new pharmaceutical products. The

Senior Manager of Statistical Programming is responsible for leading the statistical programming

Operations.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Real World Data Analytics
Job_Description:
AbbVie Data Science is the best-in-class team within its cross-industry peer group and is

responsible for bringing people, process, and technology together to generate business value from

clinical trials data. Our operational model is exemplified through execution and innovation. This role

is a key to ensuring successful delivery against the program- and study-level accountabilities

assigned to Data and Statistical Sciences.

Responsibilities:
Aligns DSS study teams with program- and study-level strategies. Supports governance of

assigned programs and studies, both within and outside DSS. Assigned programs may include

programs of any size or any complexity

For assigned programs, acts as single point of contact and accountable operational lead from DSS.

Coordinates associated DSS study teams to meet operational objectives. Engages and connects

global functional and cross-functional teams at both the program and study levels

Interacts with and influences all levels of management and cross-functional team members to

achieve program objectives. Represents DS in cross-functional forums and, if assigned, leadership

meetings

Utilizes operational analytics and project management tools to optimize execution of programs and

studies, to manage internal and external resources, to track study progress, and to prepare study

status reports. Anticipates and identifies issues that could affect timelines of own, as well as

studies managed by the team. Anticipates and identifies issues that could affect timelines or

quality and develops options and solutions

Ensure adherence to federal regulations and applicable local regulations, Good Clinical Practices

(GCPs), ICH Guidelines, AbbVie Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and to functional quality

standards. Stays abreast of new and/or evolving local regulations, guidelines and policies related

to clinical development. Coordinates and participates as the DS study owner in regulatory

inspections and internal quality audits

Participates in oversight of vendors and provides feedback related to clinical trial operations,

issues, and trends in performance

Responsible for coaching and mentoring team members, as well as providing input into their

development

Leads DSS and cross-functional innovation and process improvement initiatives

If assigned, responsible for identifying training needs and standardizing and facilitating training

solutions for DS roles. Conducts “lessons learned” across functions

May include direct and/or indirect supervision of staff, as well as contract resources

Bachelor’s degree in business, management information systems, computer science, life sciences

or equivalent. Master’s preferred. PMP Certification or Lean Six Sigma Green Belt desired.

Must have 8+ years of pharma / clinical research / data management / health care experience or

10+ years of project management experience (and / or applicable work experience).

In-depth understanding of clinical trial processes and involved functional stakeholders, and clinical

technology. Management of a clinical trial from initiation through to completion in a lead role is

required.

Demonstrated performance as a cross-functional leader. Demonstrated ability to influence others

without direct authority. Demonstrated ability to successfully coach / mentor in a matrix

environment. Demonstrated effective communication skills. Demonstrated effective analytical skills.

At AbbVie, we value bringing together individuals from diverse backgrounds to develop new and innovative solutions for patients.
